name: trichloropropane production | sulfur dioxide, liquid | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/6121/documentation

This dataset represents the production of 1,2,3-trichloropropane  by means of the reaction of allyl chloride and sulfuryl chloride. The reaction yield is assumed to be 85%  based on literature review. The system includes the process with consumption of raw materials, energy and infrastructure. It also includes the emissions to air and water.

From the reception of trichloropropane and sodium hydride at the factory gate.

This activity ends with the production of trichloropropane including materials, energy uses, infrastructure and emissions.
category: C:Manufacturing/20:Manufacture of chemicals and chemical products/201:Manufacture of basic chemicals, fertilizers and nitrogen compounds, plastics/2011:Manufacture of basic chemicals

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: the chemical reaction is assumed to be valid in a GLO context
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: 1,2,3-trichloropropane is prepared by reacting allyl chloride with sulfuryl chloride with and unexpected high yield of 80-90% by conducting the reaction in the presence of catalytically effective amount of amines and/or phosphines as catalysts. For this inventory it is assumed a yield of 85%.;The stoichiometric reaction is as follows:         C3H5Cl + SO2Cl2 = C3H5Cl3 + SO2
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: Energy consumptions and emissions as well as Infrastructure are estimated based on standard values.

exchanges.description: Based on  stoichiometric equation; yield of 85%.

flow.name: sulfur dioxide, liquid
flow.category: C:Manufacturing/20:Manufacture of chemicals and chemical products/201:Manufacture of basic chemicals, fertilizers and nitrogen compounds, plastics/2011:Manufacture of basic chemicals

exchanges.description: Calculated value based on literature values and expert opinion. See comments in the parametres' comment field.

Estimation. These values were approximated with data from an large chemical plant site in Germany producing 2.05 Mt a-1 (intermediates included) of different chemicals. The values for the energy consumption per kg of product of this plant (3.2 MJ kg-1) were used as approximation for the energy consumption of the sodium persulfate production. This total energy demand contains a split of 50% natural gas, 38% electricity and 12% steam from external energy sources. For this inventory all energy used for heat or steam was assumed to be natural gas.

exchanges.description: The COD is modelled based on the knowledge of molecular structure of acetic acid and ammonium.

The non reacted allyl chloride will leave as emissions to water. It is assumed that 10% of the non reacted allyl chloride will be emitted to the environment in water.

The formula is:
mass of allyl chloride to water =( ((1/0.85)-1)*input mass of allyl chloride)*0.1
Data from a large chemical plant in Germany (Gendorf, 2000), calculated based on overal cooling water consumption per kilogram of product. This plant produces several different products.

exchanges.description:
Regarding the 15% non-reacted allyl chloride (reaction yield is 85%), this is assumed to leave the production process with wastewater. It is further assumed that 90% of this wastewater will be treated in internal wastewater treatment. The carbon contained in the removed allyl chloride is accounted as CO2 emissions. 
Furthermore, we assume that none of the allyl chloride used in the reaction will be emitted into the air.

The equation for calculating CO2 emissions is as follows:
CO2 emissions = ((((1/0.85)-1)*mass input allyl chloride) - ally chloride emissions to air) * 0.9 * allyl chloride carbon content (fossil) * (molecular weight CO2/molecular weight C)

flow.name: Carbon dioxide, fossil
flow.category: Elementary flows/Emission to air/high population density

exchanges.description:
The non reacted sulfuryl chloride (15%)  will leave the process in the form of chlorine and sulfate  as emissions to water. It is further assumed that of the water emissions, 90% will be treated internally and  10% will end up in the environment. 

The input mass of chlorine is calculated based on the molar mass of sulfuryl chloride and chlorine and the input mass of sulfuryl chloride.

The formula is:
input mass as sulfur dioxide=( ((1/0.85)-1)*input mass of sulfur dioxide)*0.1

Calculating the input mass of sulfuryl chloride as sulfur dioxide:
input mass of sulfur dioxide = mass of sulfuryl chloride*(Molecular mass sulfur dioxide/Molecular mass sulfuryl chloride)*(1 mol sulfur dioxide/1 mol sulfuryl chloride)

Calculating the output of  sulfate from oxidation of sulfur dioxide
output mass of sulfate= input mass as sulfur dioxide *(Molecular mass sulfate/Molecular mass sulfur dioxide)*(1 mol sulfate/1 mol sulfur dioxide)

The non reacted sulfuryl chloride (15%)  will leave the process in the form of chlorine and sulfate  as emissions to water. It is further assumed that of the water emissions, 90% will be treated internally and  10% will end up in the environment. 

The input mass of chlorine is calculated based on the molar mass of sulfuryl chloride and chlorine and the input mass of sulfuryl chloride.

The formula is:
mass of chlorine to water =( ((1/0.85)-1)*input mass as chlorine)*0.1

Calculating the input mass as chlorine:
input mass as chlorine=input mass of sulfuryl chloride*(Molecular mass chlorine/Molecular mass sulfuryl chloride)*(2 mol chlorine/1 mol SO2Cl2)
Based on  stoichiometric equation; yield of 85%.
